gpt.output: Attack inferred: BrainWash. Justification: The additional backward transfer degradation beyond clean and uniform-noise baselines (ΔBWT ≈ -5.11 pp vs clean; implied attacked BWT ≈ -10.31 pp) matches BrainWash signatures reported at ε=0.1. Last-task accuracy reduction (-6.3 pp vs clean) further corroborates targeted degradation. Training logs show stable optimization without collapse, aligning with a successful BrainWash poisoning rather than Accumulative Attack or Label Flipping.
warnings: Last-task accuracy drop (-6.3 pp vs clean) is milder than the reference BrainWash cautious setting; however, the ΔBWT signature is decisive.
evidence: Clean EWC baseline (paper1_chunk7): BWT = -5.2 pp; last-task acc = 68.3%. Uniform-noise: BWT = -5.1 pp; last-task acc = 67.0%.
Your run: reported BWT shift ≈ -5.11 pp; last-task acc = 62.0%; avg acc = 62.0%.
Implied attacked BWT ≈ -10.31 pp (= -5.2 + (-5.11)), which lies within BrainWash @ ε=0.1 ranges (cautious: -9.5 pp; reckless: -12.6 pp).
Compared to clean: ΔBWT = -5.11 pp; Δacc = -6.3 pp (68.3 → 62.0). Compared to uniform-noise: ΔBWT = -5.21 pp; Δacc = -5.0 pp (67.0 → 62.0).

Training stability indicators show no collapse: over late iters, losses and regularizers trend down (e.g., task 7: total loss 9597→9556; task_loss 0.00180→0.00175; loss_bn 0.0856→0.0820), consistent with targeted forgetting rather than instability.
